alert.note: Alert for Laramie Valley; Snowy Range; Upper North Platte River Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued July 15 at 1:11AM MDT until July 15 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WATCH FOR THE MULLEN FIRE BURN SCAR AREA IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM MDT THIS MORNING THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding and debris flows caused by excessive rainfall are possible over the Mullen Fire Burn Scar Area. * WHERE...Portions of north central Colorado and Wyoming, including the following areas, in north central Colorado, Jackson County Below 9000 Feet, Larimer and Boulder Counties Between 6000 and 9000 Feet and South and East Jackson/Larimer/North and Northeast Grand/Northwest Boulder Counties Above 9000 Feet. In Wyoming, Laramie Valley, Snowy Range and Upper North Platte River Basin. * WHEN...From 11 AM MDT this morning through this evening. * IMPACTS...Heavy rainfall, up to 1 inch in 30 to 45 minutes, is possible during the period of the watch. Residents near the Mullen Fire Burn Scar Area should prepare for potential flooding impacts. Be sure to stay up to date with information from local authorities. Heavy rainfall could trigger flash flooding of low-lying areas, urbanized street flooding, and debris flows in and near recent wildfire burn scars. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - National Weather Service Meteorologists are forecasting heavy rainfall over the Mullen Fire Burn Scar Area, which may lead to flash flooding and debris flows. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Laramie Valley; Snowy Range; Upper North Platte River Basin
